bboxes.raw_text:
Jenny A. oliver, of Phoenix
Union High School is attending
Boys State at Flagstaff.


It will be double celebration
Sum-, June IL, pm. at the
Monroe School, located at 7th
St. and Monroe, when June McRae
is honored on her birthday. The
first anniver sary Of the Velvet
Tones, a gospel singing group
will be observed, too. James
Cleveland, singer from Chicago
will be a guest artist.


Your reporter is serving as
program chairman.
Miss Lee Eta Keys will marry
Willis Turner on June 20 at
Pilgrim Rest Baptist Church at
6 pm.
Miss Charlene McDaniels has
graduated from fashion designing
school. She will marry Donald
Walker in Los Angeles this week.
end.





Mr.. and Mrs. RI. Using, of
Long Beach, Calf, were guests
Of Mr.. and Mrs. Wesley Conner,
2115 E. Madison St.


Miss Faye Johnsonis attending
Y-Teen meeting in Albuquerque.

ST. AUGUSTINE, Fla. - The
summer cottage rented by DR..
Martin l.. King was set afire
by vandalS. ,.g...4-s-


Furniture was destroyed and
the fire was started in the bed.
No one was injured.


DR.. King had recently visited
the city to supervise civil rights
demonstrations

Again as inpast years, Reddy's
Corner, located at 18th st. and
E. Jeffer son, offers free paper
fans to all chur cheS.


Reddy says, appoint a mem
Der from your church to come
by Reddy's Corner and ask for
the number needed at your
church.,

Reddy Hos Free


Funs. For Churches

Mr.. and Mrs. Tommie Jewell,
Jr., and family visited their par
ents, Mr.. and Mrs. Tommie Jew
ell, Sr., of 1920 S. 10th Ave.


They left last week for Tall
lahassee Florida, where Mr..
jewell will teach summer school
again.

Although did graduate had
the party held the home of Mr. and
Mrs. Herman Mathews, ITO w. Mohave.


Larry Mathews, LeVon Robinson, Robert
Mathews Mcfarland Parean Doss Charene Cobb Joyce
Gilbert Patterson Carol Gentry, Betty Doss Herman
Mathews Ronald Gabreah Otis Wing and Jesse Underwood


Second photo Al Battle and his swinging The
Echoes made lively sounds for the part.

For SIS invested in PHOENIX,
he recovered $3.50 in TOKYO
Over 5000 miles from home, while
touring the Orient, Mr.. Paterik had
$3.50 stolen from him in American
Express Travellers Checks


Mr.. Paterik reported his loss to an
American Express Office in Tokyo, and
that same day received a refund of the
full $3.50


The cost to Mr. Paterik of getting his
money back was only Sl8O penny
per-dollar of the value of the Travellers
Checks paid when he purchased them
from the Valley Bank.


When you travel, play it safe by
carrying your funds in AMERICAN
EXPRESS TRAVELLERS CHECKS
available at all s3 Valley Bank
Offices. They're better than money
ARE accepted all over the world.
And if lost, stolen or destroyed,
your money will be speedily
funded by the neares It
AMERICAN EXPRESS office.
The story OF Ronald Henry Patcrih:'

Proud Saturday
congratulate graduating from Phoenix Union
High School,


CLYDE Fairfax scholarship award and
Phoenix Co., scholarship.


Shown above Shelby James, 2311 Wier,
sister, Clyde Wright his father, of Lockhart Texas;
Hill, sister, Phoenix and Clyde Joe Wright


graduation celebration and family reunion held at the
of Mr. Mrs. Shelby James.
